description: Travel from south Cornwall to North Cornwall on this 89 mile walking trail. You'll pass through the beautiful Tamar valley with part of the route running along the popular Tamar Valley Discovery Trail . Other highlights include the long riverside sections along the River Tamar and more waterside paths along the scenic Tamar Lakes and the lovely Bude Canal . You'll also pass through a series of pretty Cornish villages and enjoy some wonderful coastal views towards the end of the walk. The walk is marked out on the Ordnance Survey map below. It begins in southern Cornwall at the Cremyll Ferry and heads north to the coast at Morwenstow .
